arm_group.description: Comparison between healthy controls and PD patients

brief_summary.textblock:
This program aims to understand the role of the subthalamic nucleus in the control of the
      movement in healthy humans and patients with Parkinson's disease, how the STN dysfunction
      contributes to akinesia and how the STN stimulation improves motor signs in PD patients .

clinical_study.brief_title: Subthalamic Nucleus, Akinesia and Parkinson's Disease

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients with Parkinson's disease candidate to DBS surgery

          -  Age: 18-70 years

          -  Normal brain MRI

          -  Signature of the informed written consent

          -  Healthy age-matched control subjects

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  contraindication to MRI

          -  contraindication to DBS surgery for PD patients

clinical_study.official_title: Role of the Subthalamic Nucleus in the Control of Movement: Physiopathology of Akinesia in Parkinson's Disease.

other_outcome.description: Changes in the BOLD signal during fMRI with virtual imagery of movement

oversight_info.authority: France: Afssaps - Agence française de sécurité sanitaire des produits de santé (Saint-Denis)

primary_outcome.description: Changes in the neuronal activity of the STN before, during and after the execution of an arm movement
primary_outcome.measure: Firing rate of the subthalamic neurons
primary_outcome.time_frame: During surgery for bilateral STN stimulation

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Local-field potentials recordings with DBS electrodes when performing the execution of an arm movement or gait initiation
secondary_outcome.measure: Evoked related potentials of the STN
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3-5 days after surgery for bilateral STN stimulation

secondary_outcome.description: Gait initiation parameters by using a forceplate and EMG recordings

clinical_study.source: Institut National de la Santé Et de la Recherche Médicale, France

lead_sponsor.agency: Institut National de la Santé Et de la Recherche Médicale, France

clinical_study.study_design: Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Basic Science
